**Seed Starter Pots**: Use the inner lining of a cereal box to create biodegradable seed starter pots. Cut the box into sections, leaving the bottom intact. Fill each section with soil and seeds. Once the seedlings are ready to be transplanted, you can plant the entire pot in the ground, as it will decompose over time.

**Travel-Friendly Snack Holder**: Repurpose a cereal box into a portable snack holder for road trips or picnics. Cut the box to create individual compartments for different snacks, like nuts, dried fruits, or granola bars. Seal it with tape and take it along for an organized and waste-free snacking experience.

**Craft Supply Organizer**: Cut and fold a cereal box into a stylish organizer for craft supplies. Use the sections to hold markers, glue sticks, scissors, and other small items. You can personalize it with paint or decorative paper to match your craft room or workspace.

**Pet Toy**: Create a fun and engaging toy for your pets by cutting a cereal box into various shapes and filling it with treats or crumpled paper. Cats will enjoy batting it around, while dogs can enjoy the challenge of getting the treats out. Itâ€™s a great way to keep your pets entertained while recycling.

**Photo Frame**: Fashion a unique photo frame from a cereal box. Cut out a rectangular piece to fit your photo, then create a border by cutting and folding the remaining box material. Decorate it with paint, markers, or stickers. This can be a fun gift or a creative way to display your favorite memories.
